profile_positions.company: International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda, Appeals Chamber Support Unit, The Hague
profile_positions.title: Legal Officer

profile_positions.description:
- Legal advisory: Provided legal advice to the Prosecutor, senior management and the Office’s Divisions and Sections in relation to the general functioning of the Office of The Prosecutor (OTP) as an independent Organ.
- Applied legal expertise to analyse draft briefs and memoranda, and provided legal advice to the Senior Legal Advisor in relation to investigations and prosecution teams.
-Conducted legal research and took a position on emerging complex legal issues in the Office of the Prosecutor.
-Supervised the research and drafting of legal memoranda of junior lawyers.
-Assisted with the selection of seconded persons, visiting professionals and interns.
-Policy Formulation: Supervised/oversaw the preparation of policy papers and training materials, and contributed to internal and external training, notably represented the Office at the training of trainers in the NATO Centre for Excellence in the prevention of sexual and gender-based crimes in crisis situations; which proceedings are due to be published as a Training Manual for NATO.
-Drafted templates (standard operating procedures) for engaging gratis personnel, seconded personnel, junior professionals and other human-resource-related matters.
-Facilitated and liaised with respective Sections to prepare the implementation of OTP policies on key issues identified by the Prosecutor, which included the policy on sexual and gender-based crimes.
-Coordinated the drafting of the policy implementation document for the Children’s Policy.
-Led and coordinated the drafting of a new policy on cultural property from start to finish with remarkable success.
-External Relations: Prepared and coordinated the drafting of agreements with other organs of the Court and external institutions or States Parties.
-Administrative law: Conducted research and litigated cases in Administrative law on behalf of the Office of the Prosecutor.
profile_positions.title: Legal Advisor

profile_positions.description:
-Coordinated, supervised and managed operational monthly financial expenditures for the situation countries and operations conducted at the Head Office and in five other field situations.
-Planned and managed operations, logistics for staff and witnesses for the Office of the Prosecutor for field missions. 
-Conducted risk/threat/security and vulnerability assessment for staff, witnesses and victims and provided strategic advice and guidance to the Prosecutor on formulating tailored/focused approaches to be employed for specific situations. 
-Prepared situational concepts of operation advising the Prosecutor on resources and logistics required to support a situation. 
-Managed and provided witness support and protection for Prosecution witnesses for situations under my charge.
-Conducted investigations on incidents relating to Staff misconduct and conflicts between Staff.
-Prepared monthly budgets, ensured that the funds were disbursed in a timely manner to respective situations, oversaw the preparation of the monthly expenditure reports, supervised and coordinated the preparation of monthly mission activities in cooperation with investigations teams for the office of the prosecutor. 
-Prepared and revised operational manuals and standard operating procedures.
-Assumed a leadership role in relation to the drafting and reviewing of crucial online training courses on fieldcraft. 
-Participated in the conducting of training and development of an online training course on the operational manual.
profile_positions.title: Operations Officer

profile_positions.description:
-Established a witness/victims/whistleblower support/protection programme for Staff and refugees cooperating with the Office of the Inspector General on an investigation relating to Sexual Exploitation and Abuse (SEA). 
-Carried out investigations into sexual exploitation and abuse by UN Staff and other humanitarian staff working with refugees in Eastern Congo and Western Rwanda. 
-Conducted security assessments for victims and witnesses and made recommendations for appropriate support and protection to be offered by the UNHCR. 
-Established local and international contacts to partner with the UNHCR in the implementation of the support and protection programme.
